title: Unarmed Security Guard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: The interview process for an unarmed security guard includes a screening call, in-person or virtual interview, background check, and reference verification to assess qualifications, skills, and suitability for the role.
Interview Questions: Can you describe a situation where you had to handle a difficult or challenging individual while maintaining professionalism and de-escalating the situation?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Group interview. Questions about experiences and interests. Might have a second round of interviews with other people in research lab. Did not reach out to my references befoe being hired.
Interview Questions: What type of statistical softwares have you used?

title: Equity Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Extensive finance and accounting questions specifically about DCF models and how these models impact equity valuations. Also was asked to describe different economic concepts and impact on future valuations for domestic and emerging market funds.
Interview Questions: Describe WACC and explain how it impacts FCFF

title: Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Includes interview with coordinator and student coordinators, once hired you to need to pass written and tour test with student coordinator after training. Training prepares you well and is usually a week long before the fall term.
Interview Questions: Talk about your involvement on campus.

title: Student Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Dec 2022
Interview Descriptions: There are only one round in this interview. And the interview is easy and chill. Just talk more about yourself. Highly recommand to apply for this job if you are student.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about yourself?

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: I went through two rounds of interviews.  Questions were sent in advance, which is nice, I suppose, but it also made the interview feel more awkward at times. Everyone was nice but the process seemed a bit disorganized. No reply after followup.
Interview Questions: What issues do you expect advisees might want to discuss in this particular program?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: I was asked basic ("soft skills") type questions, then I was given a writing task. Also they gave me an overview of the job. They asked about my teaching background and my academic background.
Interview Questions: I was given an academic article about second language acquisition to summarize for language teachers.

title: Data Center Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Easy and smooth, people were very nice and knew what they expected of you. Small group of people interviewed me and they wanted to know what my qualifications were and recommend.
Interview Questions: Where do you think technology is heading

title: Student Sales Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: The most relaxed interview I've ever had. I sat down on a couch with two very cool members of the professional staff and they wanted to hear about my interests inside and outside of work.
Interview Questions: If you had to sell hot chocolate in Florida, how would you do it.

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview process. Overall, all the interviewers were friendly and genuinely wanted to get to know me. It is clear that they are looking for someone who is reliable, can maintain their certification, and will contribute to a positive work environment.
Interview Questions: If you work an opening shift, how will you wake yourself up and make sure you are alert in the morning?

title: Graduate Research Assiatnt Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Talk to the processor and discuss your own research experience and skill set. The prof will introduce the project then and see if you are a good match. Generally, it depends on the prof and the department.
Interview Questions: what was your contribution to that paper?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: One on one talk with PI of the lab. Asked the usual questions about course and laboratory experience . They were very nice and understanding about my experience and school schedule. Fairly easy process.
Interview Questions: Can you describe any coursework you have taken that relates to the research projects conducted in this lab?

title: Museum Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: After sending in my application, I heard nothing back from anyone, even after the supposed start date. An organization such as this should at least reach out. I was overall extremely disappointed in my experience. Offensively unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What my work experience was

title: Intake and operations specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed was offered the job, horrible work environment and horrible pay for graduates.  Horrible management, and they cycle through employees like crazy, and management is terrible. I don't think people should apply for this job unless you want to be treated like you work in retail.
Interview Questions:
Describe your day to day routine when you work with a team

How do you work with others

What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Required submission of Resume, CV, and supplemental questions. Interviewed remotely over Zoom with two individuals, and gave questions beforehand to ensure the best interview experience. After the interview, was sent an Excel test to check Excel understanding.
Interview Questions: How would you handle coworker conflict?

title: Global Engagement Programs Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Not too hard. Situation based interview questions are common in interview scenarios that depend on candidate's soft skills, discretion, response to various workplace scenarios, etc to see how the candidate would react in a given situation.
Interview Questions: How would you respond to (XYZ) Situation in the workplace?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough interview. The interviewer was kind but also concise in their question-asking. Working at the University of Oregon means having a great group of co-workers that are there to lift you up.
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit at the University of Oregon?

title: Shift Lead Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable and quick, employers respond in a short and timely manner. Relaxed interview and interviewers made me feel like I was interviewing them as much as they were me.
Interview Questions: How do I see myself fitting into the organization and work space?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: My boss asked me bunch of questions about the reasons why i'm applying for the position. I told her it was for my tuition. Everything went smooth. I would definitely go back to work for them again.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position

title: Photo Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Short interview via Zoom with photo lab manager. They were very personable and asked about experience with photo development processes. Experience with film photo development preferred but is not required for this position.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with film/photo development?

title: BTC Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was great! The interviewer was positive and upbeat! He gave a lot of insight into the company and created a safe space. A lot of technical questions about the basics of troubleshooting technology.
Interview Questions: Do you know how to troubleshoot a printer?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly routine. The questions pertained to background experience and competencies for the job. The interview only lasted thirty minutes and revolved mostly around how background experience relates to the position. Ensure proper preparation for the interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Admissions and Records Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through UO careers site. It was several weeks before I was contact for an interview. I had two rounds of interviews, each with multiple people and lasting an hour or more. A couple of weeks after my second interview I was told I was a finalist and my references would be contacted. All of my references informed me they had been contacted, but another week went by and I didn't hear anything. I received no response to my follow up and eventually found out I wasn't selected when my application status updated in the portal.
Interview Questions: The questions were fairly standard, I don't remember specifics at this point.

title: Instrument Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews with hiring committee.   Very to the point and technical for the first.  30 minutes long. No fluff.  Second was more of a get to know you interview with some questions to fill in knowledge gaps. 60 minutes long
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience in repair, use, and research with said instrumen.t

title: Painter Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was pretty easy and the employers were nice, we had great conversation about the work requirements and some benefit coming with it as well. the hiring process was pretty quick, we talked more about the pro and con of the work and what to do in case of emergency.
Interview Questions: why do you think you are a great fit for our company?

title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Relatively general interview process.  Very informal and had to stop by the Professor's office during office hours.  The interview consisted primarily of questions targeted at past experience and why interested in the professor's research, and further how I would be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Please tell me about yourself?

title: LLC Housing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Super simple, and very basic questions.  They asked me everything that a normal interview asks. He said hhe preferred honesty when being interviewed. He did say you have to work over either thanksgiving break, Christmas break, or spring break.
Interview Questions: What is your best skill? What is one thing your friend would say about you?

title: Lab Room Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and cover letter and I was called in for an in person interview afterwards. It was a straight forward process with mostly behaviorally questions, and the interviewer was really nice!
Interview Questions: How do you respond under pressure?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Just one round of interview. Asked my previous experience about research projects. Also asked my grads. Depend on the professor and position you are applying for (I am in CIS department).
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research projects.

title: Student Advocate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Very polite and the directors are nicely asking me questions that are relevant to the job, I liked it and I would like to recommend it to the future candidates
Interview Questions: Q: why did you apply for this job?

title: Library Tech Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: I was asked about various software I was familiar with and about coding experience. They also asked me about how to fix issues on both mac and pc operating systems.
Interview Questions: How would you instruct someone how to make a peanut butter and jelly sandwich?

title: Computer Lab Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: All I did was talk about myself and the classes I was taking in this lead my employer to ask me questions about classes I was taking in from there I got the job.
Interview Questions: Where are you from? What are you passionate about? Why does technology interest you?

title: Operations Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Formal and understanding, they were patient and made you feel heard. It initially started off with many applicants, they meet you in group interviews and then if you seemed to fit the position they would offer a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: What does integrity mean to you?

title: Guest Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Met with the head of the department in a group setting and talked about our experience working in a team and following procedures. They asked us to talk about how we would handle certain guest interactions.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Caterer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Easy, employer was very nice and it was more of a conversation rather than an interview. Asked about my past experience and why I want to work for the University.
Interview Questions: tell me about your background

title: Associate Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: The process was clear and straightforward. Interviews with peers and manager that asked questions about the job role and responsibilities. It was over three rounds of interviews and the process was laid out ahead of time.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this role?

title: Front Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Brief and direct. Basic questions about how you would handle different situations. Examples of questions that were asked: "how would you handle a situation where the phone is ringing and you have customers in line, who would you attend to first?"
Interview Questions: How would you handle a situation where the phone is ringing and you have customers in line, who would you attend to first?

title: Student Equipment Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed and casual the main part was trying out during the probationary period/tryout part in the spring. You sit down the head of equipment and the supervisor, they grill you with some questions and then you will work for the team for 3 months i.e April-June and if are can complete task competently you will be hired on.
Interview Questions: What kind of experiences do you bring to the team.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Was very brief, submitted a resume to the manager and was called in for a basic interview regarding questions about my resume and prior work experience. Was not difficult at all.
Interview Questions: How would you be a good fit on this team?

title: Ticket Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Met in a room with three higher up employees for about 10 to 15 minutes. They had all their questions prepared and wrote down my responses. It was a simple interview process with mostly general questions about customer service.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with various customer service problems?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Applied on the website and got an interview within 2 weeks. Only the professor interviewed you and emailed you about your additional duty. You will get notice within the week.
Interview Questions:
What's your experience? 
What's your class load?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: After applying, I met with the head of the tutoring center and discussed how I would handle possible tutoring situations. Basic situations that tutors often have to deal with.  Also discussed tutoring experience   I had.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student came in looking stressed?

title: Prospect Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: I loved the interview process. I started with a 1 on 1 interview with the office manager, and then moved on to a panel of employees for the 2nd interview. Everyone was very kind, and genuinely wanted to know about me and my experience. I never felt stumped or tricked by any of the questions.
Interview Questions: Describe your attention to detail, and provide an example from work or school.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call for an interview. Then thre was a one hour Zoom video conferencing with four members of the team as well as the hiring manger.  Then I received a request to check references.  Lastly I was told that I was not selected.  I tried to ask why and if there was anything wrong with reference checking but didn't hear back.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stress at work?

title: Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Came in on campus, into the recreation center and there was a panel of employers who asked me questions about why I wanted the position and why I think I would be a good it
Interview Questions: What does integrity mean to you?

title: Student Financial Controller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly simple. It began with an audio interview where I had to record an answer to a couple different posed questions. It was conducted through an online service meant specifically for this. After that I had to go to a physical interview where I was asked by the current controller team and professional staff a number of different questions about how I would handle certain situations, as well as other standard interview questions.
Interview Questions:
Q: How would you handle a difficult customer?
Q: How would you communicate the rules that need to be followed for purchases?
Q: What is your ideal type of team structure?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted several weeks after applying on a Thursday and told the interview had to take place the next day during work hours, so I had to scramble to figure out my current work schedule. The interview itself was okay, but they spent a lot of time talking about themselves, instead of asking me questions. Took them a month to let me know I didn’t get the job.
Interview Questions: What do you like to do outside of work?

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Positive experience. Two interviews that really helped me and the Bike Program team decide that I was a good fit. Interviewed by most of the staff for the Bike Program.
Interview Questions: Describe your relationship to bikes.

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of me applying online, e-mailing a Student Resource person expressing my interest in the job. I was then contacted by the Sous Chef of the Catering department.
Interview Questions: Have you worked in a kitchen before?

title: Contract & Operations Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: There were three required parts of this interview process that took almost two months to finish. First, several  written essays, then a phone interview with three search committee members followed by an in person panel interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: It wasn’t too bad, mainly behavioral. The interview was easy going and conversation, nothing really nerve wracking about the process. The hardest part was writing a cover letter that was better than other students
Interview Questions: What is something you can bring into this job?

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Formal and on site. Before the interview, there is some paper work. One round of interview with the dinning manager. The whole process is around an hour.  One of the questions is "How would you balance your responsibilities". There are proper training and testing afterwards.
Interview Questions: How would you balance your responsibilities.

title: Videographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Phone screener, then Skype with management. No in-person interview, hiring process took a long time due to State of Oregon red tape and background checks. Probably not typical for all positions at the University.
Interview Questions: None of the questions were out of the ordinary, very straight forward

title: Community Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Two part interview that is scored numerically.  Be specific. Include specific identities when talking about supporting the community. It helps to be energetic the people interviewing you are potential co-workers and they are scoring you too. Get them to want to work with you.
Interview Questions: What type of community events would you put on?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: It took a little over the month after the job posting closed to get notice of an interview. The interview process was great - very organized and thorough. The interview consisted of two staff and the director. They took turns asking  pre determined questions (they gave me a printout of the questions). All three gave very informative answers to all of the questions I had. I also had about an hour of informal time with most of the other department staff - again, very informative.
Interview Questions: The questions were not difficult but the main focus of the position was a bit different than what I got from the job posting. So, I felt a little unprepared for a couple of questions.

title: Dining Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
I knew one of my friends who worked in the kitchen already. 
I was able to call up the manager and I was hired and trained with a group of about six others.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working in a kitchen.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very brief. They called me in an hour before my interview. It was super informal. It was just me and head of the card office in a booth in the Emu. Lasted about ten minutes was offered the job on the spot.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Accounts Payable Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied in person in Oregon Hall, got the interview the next day, and the interview itself took about 30 minutes. It was very laid back and friendly. I talked with Accounts Payable Manager and Clerk.
Interview Questions: Tell us how your past professional experiences can help you succeed here?

title: Business Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: No interview,  I got the job from knowing a professor and from there it was a very easy process to get the job. I would recommend knowing lots of different teachers in the business school so that you can better prepare yourself
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 3-5 years

title: Student Alumni Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Friendly. Talked to two people. Was able to ask questions about true program and how this position would fit in. Was really forthcoming with details about the job and what they were expecting.
Interview Questions: What would you bring to the table? Do you have any grand vision?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The entire process reflected well on the hiring department and search committee at the University. I applied online and heard from a committee representative a couple weeks later. The interviews occurred in two stages: an initial Skype conversation with the search committee and then, one month later, a day of departmental meetings/presentations in person in Eugene (expenses paid). Ultimately, I pursued another opportunity but was grateful for the positive interview experience.
Interview Questions: A mix of behavioral and relevant technical questions (SQL, SAS, statistical inference and modeling, etc.)

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly simple as it is for a student job.  I applied online. They called me in. It was a short interview. The really just wanted to get to know me.
Interview Questions: What do you study. What are you future goals. Why do you see yourself fit here

title: Orientations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Asked compare and Contrast questions as well as opinions on different UO policies and events. It was a group panel format and asked a lot about involvement with the University and what i've done so far.
Interview Questions: What has your experience within the University been thus far?

title: Graduate Teaching Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Submitted a resume and was notified within a few weeks that a position had opened up. Very simple process and there was not very much paperwork. The office staff is amazing and very efficient at doing their job. Not a single complaint when it comes interacting with them through email or in person. Payroll is an easy process once direct deposit is set up.
Interview Questions: There was no interview, but I included a description of my background and ability to teach in my application email.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR)
Interview Descriptions: Walked in, said I took the class and got an A, got the job. That was it. It may have helped that I had a friend who worked there, but even without that I would've just had to show some coding knowledge
Interview Questions: None

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Video interview since I was an out of state candidate. They contacted all of my references before setting up the interview. It was very informal, a 4 person panel, all of which were involved in the research project. Went over resume, why I was interested and what I could offer based on each duty listed in the job description. They didn't make an offer and I had to e-mail them to find out I wasn't selected well after the date they said they would make a decision by. It was unclear whether they were even going to e-mail me a rejection or not unless I asked.
Interview Questions: Very informal

title: Food Services Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: No Interview, was hired on the spot. People had to wait in line at a table in order to apply for the position. The university posted when they held interviews.
Interview Questions: Student information was required along with preferred places to work and hours needed per week. A max of 20 hours was allowed.

title: Analyst Programmer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: A week after the deadline, have a phone interview. Mostly behavioral questions. Another week later, meet the team on campus and have a group/panel interview after a coding exercise. Most questions are either about technical skills or behavioral practice.
Interview Questions: coding, technical and behavioral questions

title: Intramural Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: They sat me down in a room full of current supervisors and the current boss.  They asked roughly 20 questions varying from personal details such as age, year, major to situational questions about the job.  They were all very relevant.  After the interview process they did a walk through of your daily job and you shadowed a current supervisor.
Interview Questions: If you were working a night outside on the turf fields and a thunder storm rolled in, what would you do?  How would you handle the current and future games?

title: Teamwork Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quick process, they take you to a large room with a bunch of people.  Fairly intimidating if you're not expecting it. About fifteen generic questions. Nothing crazy, like why do you want to work here, what skills do you have to make you a great person, leadership stuff, teamwork stuff
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?  Tell us a time where you've been in a leadership role

title: Office Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process takes a long time. Heard back one month after applying to schedule initial interview. First interview was with just two people, immediate supervisors of position. Two weeks later did a second interview (as one of two finalists) that was a full day. Met with several different teams I would be working with. Questions were focused on experience and team working skills. Very focused on importance of collaboration and attitude.
Interview Questions: "Please tell us about a time you didn't get along with co-workers or supervisor. What did you do?"

title: Server Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Put in my resume and was contacted by email about a month later. I went in for an interview that week and was eventually hired to start at the beginning of the next term. The interview process was super relaxed and a lot of cool ppl work there!
Interview Questions: It was actually a pretty standard interview. What are your strengths, what are your weaknesses, why do you want to work here etc.

title: Accounting Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: The application was submitted to HR and then was received by the department. The entire process took about a month. The department interview was made up of 4 other people (both faculty and staff). Overall pretty easy, but the process took a long time. When I started there was a backlog of work to make up.
Interview Questions: Easy group interview with basic questions.

title: Infrastructure Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went into a conference room with four senior staff members, they asked me questions about previous employment and made sure I would be up for some of the grungier tasks involved in the position. They just seemed to want to get to know me and make sure my resume accurately reflected my skills.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience working with power tools?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process. Review of applications lasted over 5 weeks. The panel consisted of 4 individuals, two of them were foreigners and had heavy accents. The interview was over skype so it was tremendously difficult to understand them but they were the type of people you'd have a hard time understanding in person. The other two were staff of the department and one of them was quite arrogant. I was surprised to see that no senior level staff or director was on the panel. After all, isn't a seasoned manager the type of individual that can identify talent and pursue a new hire who will complement the team? What's worse is that I waited over a month to hear back that I hadn't made it to the second phase. Actually, I got in touch with them a month later and waited about a week to hear that I wasn't being considered.
Interview Questions: One of the foreign panelists gave me a scenario involving an international student who suffers for social anxiety and performs poorly. At least I think that was the gist but I honestly think I missed most of the question because it was so difficult to understand, it was through skype and the panelist stumbled on their words. It thought it impolite to ask them to repeat the question and that may have contributed to my performance.

title: Social Media Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with 5 people, got a little awkward, wasn't sure who exactly to direct my question to or talk to. Asked very specific questions about what I would do in specific situations - and why. Also, got asked back-to-back questions in rapid fire, which caused me to get sort of overwhelmed.
Interview Questions: "Describe your desired timeline of social media posts for a football game day"

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Minimum of three (3) years’ experience interpreting and analyzing statistical and financial information, applying strong analytical and problem-solving skills with close attention to detail, and making recommendations
Exhibiting excellent communication skills (oral and written), strong interpersonal, organizational and time management skills
Demonstrating expert level knowledge in MS Excel and strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, etc.) software
Interview Questions:
and problem-solving skills with close attention to detail, and making recommendations
Exhibiting excellent communication skills (oral and written), strong interpersonal, organizational and time management skills
Demonstrating expert level knowledge in MS Excel and strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Outlook, etc.) software

title: Libarary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Apply and then get a interview
Interview Questions: not difficult

title: FIG Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: With two interviewers, who were pretty engaging and friendly. They asked very standard questions-- a lot of scenario questions. The entire interview lasted approximately 30 minutes, and they got back to you with a job offer within one week. Overall, not a bad interview! I would recommend just reviewing standard interview questions, which can easily be found online.
Interview Questions: What is one of your weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: It helps to already have worked in the department, and for management to already want to hire you. It is an unfair advantage to others on the outside, but fulfills a hiring process legality. To find out if a job is already taken, call and ask if anyone from the department is being considered or has applied.
Interview Questions: No questions were difficult or unexpected.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Phone screening then face to face interview. This will vary depending on the department. Some are very formal and some are informal. Find out who is on the hiring committee as some departments are small and you can tailor a more formal and personal cover letter
Interview Questions: Describe a time you've face an adverse situation and how did you handle it.

title: Publisher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience with a lot of really nice and interesting people.
Interview Questions: What is the first thing I would change about the magazine.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: submit a application form online quite easily and get email for the offer
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Systems Infrastructure Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It is very controlled and by-the-book. They ask everybody the same questions, have to follow a script and have limited time for follow-up questions. It can take months to go from initial application to job offer.
Interview Questions: How do you like to communicate with your coworkers and customers?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Write report, Skype interview. I send my application directly to the Professor who is the PI of the project. He got back to me with an assignment within an hour asking me to send him my idea about the project I applied for. The project well fits to my experience and therefore I send him a two page report within the next 3 hours. After that, I got a Skype interview with two Professors, one from UofO and another one from Kent State University. Within a week, I got my offer and accepted it.
Interview Questions: What would you like to be in the next 10 years?

title: Quality Assurance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: A simple, brief interview about my university experience. I graduated from UO so they were familiar with what was expected of me knowledge-wise. I sent an email to the hiring group and they set up a 30 minute interview just to get an idea of who I am and what my skillset is.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with Amazon Web Services?

title: EMU Student Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Oregon
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward and simple. One interview consisting of 10-15 questions.
Interview Questions: What prior experience qualifies you for this job?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple sit-down with the supervisor. I was asked about my goals and how I was able to balance working while being a student myself. It was a very easy and laid back process. They were in need of tutors and that made the whole process less stressful.
Interview Questions: How will you be able to balance your own heavy course load while tutoring?

title: Barista Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: Brought my application and was interviewed by the Manager and Assistant Manager. It was more of a get-to-know you interview to see if I would mesh with current staff members.
Interview Questions: What makes you a fit for this position?

title: Office Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Almost all Office Specialist II interviews start with a preliminary phone interview, followed by in-person interview. The timing between interviews can vary depending on the time to fill the position. Expect the process to take several months from point of application to final interview. Applications for this position are very competitive, but less so than a Office Specialist I. Be sure you know what department you are interviewing with and why you would be a good fit for that specific department. Questions are usually behavioral based.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for the position?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Pretty straight forward questions that dealt with food service, safety within HACCP, and supervisory experience. Process took a while to know whether or not I was hired after the interview as they tend to do a lot of interviewing for various positions.
Interview Questions: Please tell me how to use a three compartment sink.

title: Art Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a generally good experience. However, the interviewers had not made up their mind about what they were looking for in the position. The people were friendly and forthcoming, but it was hard to pitch oneself without a clear sense of what the department was looking for.
Interview Questions: Theoretical questions beyond my field.

title: Adjunct Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Hideous!  All kinds of personal, discrimnatory questions.  Interviewer discussed his political and social preferences and asked me mine.  Interviewer wanted me to travel with him and be a "partner" of his own consulting business, in addition to working at the University.
Interview Questions: Would I like to become his "consulting partner" and "travel with him".  Inference was that my appointment to the University was contingent on this "private" arrangement.

title: MAP Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Oregon in Dec 2011
Interview Descriptions: I contacted the MAP Library to find out if they were hiring. I received an email several days later asking to set up an interview time, and requesting my resume. The interview was long--over an hour. It was fairly informal, but I wore a suit, and I believe that gave me an edge on the many other applicants. After the interview (about 4-5 days later), I received a phone call from the head technician stating that I was hired.
Interview Questions: This interview has some very tricky questions. You MUST know the geography of Oregon. He will ask you to quickly identify a number of locations on a large map of Oregon. (think Multnomah Falls, John Day River, Bend, etc.) You will also need to match aerial photos to topographic maps. Do not distress if you get a question or two wrong, or it takes you a little while. Do the best you can and remain calm. I missed two and still got the job.

title: New Employee Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Mass interview done by student employees. you and about 10 other students are interviewed by 3-5 student managers. You never meet the professional staff until you are hired. I liked this aspect as you work primarily with the student managers so it makes sense that they would run the interviews.
Interview Questions: What does customer service mean to you?

title: Office Specialist II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: 3 different interview panels with 3-4 on each panel.  The panels were made up from people who dealt with the department on some level, but only the final interview panel was made up of the actual department members. Director made job offer to my husband by phone, including starting salary.  This seemed strange and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: When placement tests required hand-scoring, and strict time requirement were in place, what would you do if you couldn't locate the previously scheduled faculty members and time was running out?

title: Football Player Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is completely based on film from high school combined with athletic ability and what they believe will be your potential growth physically. The process for high school players is a meat market, much like the NFL. The walk on process is basically a two or three day tryout, but they do not get paid a dime except during bowl season when they get $30 a day for food.
Interview Questions: What is your goal

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Meet with the Director get a tour of the place. Director interviews you about the job description and what you would be responsible for. Makes sure that you are qualified and willing to learn about the different programs and assist students/faculty in different languages.
Interview Questions: do you know about computers?

title: Information Technology Consultant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Oregon (Eugene, OR) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions: After initial HR filtering, I was interviewed by a panel of upper-level management.  They explained the position, the role of the department, etc and then began asking me questions.  Questions consisted of hypothetical situations and the best solution, questions such as the difference between IMAP/POP and when to use each, etc.  Testing portion created a scenario where a new employee needed accounts created, etc.  There was a PC side and a Mac side to the test, as well as basic hardware understanding (monitor wasn't plugged in right, keyboard was loose, etc)
Interview Questions: Create a Google Account and set to sync IMAP with OSX Mail.app (timed)
